thread.title: 'Adorable!': World's smallest fox with massive ears makes debut
thread.title_full: 'Adorable!': World's smallest fox with massive ears makes debut

author: Mark Molloy
title: 'Adorable!': World's smallest fox with massive ears makes debut
text:
M ove aside cute cats and bleating goats, the internet has just fallen in love with a new animal: the adorable Fennec Fox.
Taronga Zoo in Australia is celebrating a birth from the world’s smallest fox species, with the curious kit making its much-anticipated public debut this week.
“The little one is beginning to spend a lot more time outdoors. We’re seeing it playing, rolling around on its back and chasing after mum and dad,” said keeper Deb Price.
T he infant is the seventh for experienced parents Kebili and Zinder, who have successfully raised two previous litters, explained experts at the zoo in Sydney, New South Wales.
“The parents are doing a fantastic job again, with Zinder proving to be a particularly attentive dad. We’ve seen him filling up his mouth with food and then racing back to deliver it to the kit,” said Deb.
O ne thing that makes the Fennec Fox stand out from the crowd is the animal’s huge ‘Dumbo-like’ ears.
“The Fennec Fox has enormous bat-like ears that appear to be on loan from a much larger relative,” the zoo said in a release.
“These ears can grow to more than 15 centimetres in length and help the foxes to dissipate heat and keep cool in the desert sun of northern Africa.”
Meet the charming 'two-faced' cat taking the internet by storm
